Sentencas: Recent experimental studies have shown how A-site nonstoichiometry in Na0.5Bi0.5TiO3 (NBT) can dramatically alter its electrical properties and conduction mechanisms.
Titulo: Crystal structure, defect chemistry and oxygen ion transport of the ferroelectric perovskite, Na0.5Bi0.5TiO3: insights from first-principles calculations

Sentencas: In nominal NBT and Bi-deficient NBi0.49T, electrical conductivity primarily comes from oxygen ion conduction and not electronic conduction.
Titulo: Crystal structure, defect chemistry and oxygen ion transport of the ferroelectric perovskite, Na0.5Bi0.5TiO3: insights from first-principles calculations

Sentencas: This is contrary to the behaviour of traditional titanates and could potentially give NBT a role in the design of new intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs).
Titulo: Crystal structure, defect chemistry and oxygen ion transport of the ferroelectric perovskite, Na0.5Bi0.5TiO3: insights from first-principles calculations

Sentencas: In this study, we use density functional theory (DFT) with the Hubbard U correction to investigate the much debated local structure and defect chemistry of NBT, with the primary focus on oxygen vacancy formation and oxygen ion transport.
Titulo: Crystal structure, defect chemistry and oxygen ion transport of the ferroelectric perovskite, Na0.5Bi0.5TiO3: insights from first-principles calculations

Sentencas: We confirm significant cation and oxygen displacement in both the Cc and R3c structures.
Titulo: Crystal structure, defect chemistry and oxygen ion transport of the ferroelectric perovskite, Na0.5Bi0.5TiO3: insights from first-principles calculations

Sentencas: Small ordering energies confirm an essentially random distribution of A-site ions.
Titulo: Crystal structure, defect chemistry and oxygen ion transport of the ferroelectric perovskite, Na0.5Bi0.5TiO3: insights from first-principles calculations

Sentencas: Oxygen vacancies are shown to preferentially form in the vicinity of Bi ions, confirming that weak Bi-O bonds do indeed promote oxygen ion migration.
Titulo: Crystal structure, defect chemistry and oxygen ion transport of the ferroelectric perovskite, Na0.5Bi0.5TiO3: insights from first-principles calculations

Sentencas: Nudged elastic band (NEB) calculations predict oxygen migration energies that are in excellent agreement with experiment.
Titulo: Crystal structure, defect chemistry and oxygen ion transport of the ferroelectric perovskite, Na0.5Bi0.5TiO3: insights from first-principles calculations

Sentencas: Oxygen ion migration to Bi-rich chemical environments is generally shown to be unfavourable, while migration to Na-rich chemical environments produces lower migration energies.
Titulo: Crystal structure, defect chemistry and oxygen ion transport of the ferroelectric perovskite, Na0.5Bi0.5TiO3: insights from first-principles calculations

Sentencas: Our calculations confirm many of the assumptions recently reported in experimental studies and provide a far greater understanding into the unique and complex defect chemistry of NBT than is currently available.
Titulo: Crystal structure, defect chemistry and oxygen ion transport of the ferroelectric perovskite, Na0.5Bi0.5TiO3: insights from first-principles calculations
